pathAssistantSteps.info:
Meetings with members of the district Decision-Making Team are conducted to identify the problem(s) being addressed, confirm philosophical alignment, qualify interest, and determine sense of urgency, budget, decision process, and timeline.


Entry: Implementation meets ARC's Qualification Criteria and district Decision-Making Team agrees to meeting

Exit: Preliminary project proposal/options developed for delivery


Customer Buying Milestones:


  • Customer further defines needs and goals.
  • Improvement Questions are answered
  • Preliminary project scope is outlined.
  • Customer confirms ARC as a potential partner.


Confidence Level Coaching: All proposals enter pipeline as the default level of Possible. Is your customer indicating that they are more likely to partner with ARC?


Pipeline Level Coaching: Do you have enough information to draft a proposal?

Continue to meet with all stakeholders to develop trust and credibility by designing proposal options that meet the unique needs of the district while effectively positioning ARC ahead of the competition.


Entry: Preliminary project proposal/options delivered to customer

Exit: Final project proposal(s) designed and delivered to customer


Customer Buying Milestones:


  • Customer requirements and timeline finalized and communicated.
  • District identifies project goals and measurable outcomes.
  • Customer communicates all feasible options for implementation, including competition


Confidence Level Coaching: As you gather more information about customer needs and requirements, is the customer indicating that an ARC partnership is the "right fit"?


Pipeline Level Coaching: The goal of this phase is to deliver a final or near final proposal to the customer.

Present a final proposal. Confirm our unique capability to address the district’s requirements. The district approves the ARC solution and confirms details on the Implementation Overview.


Entry: Final project proposal(s) submitted for approval

Exit: Decision-Making Team approves final project proposal and implementation summary


Customer Buying Milestones:


  • Customer evaluates options and completes proof activities
  • Approves final project proposal, timeline, and implementation plan
  • Confirms consensus of all stakeholders.
  • Agrees to implementation summary


Confidence Level Coaching: Are you asking enough questions to be confident that ARC is a viable solution and that there is internal support for our solution?


Pipeline Level Coaching: What sales activities are you executing to ensure buy in at all levels of the organization?

Work with the district departments (Procurement, Business Office, Operations, and Board of Directors) to obtain Purchase Order and ensure all closing requirements are met. Manage the coordination of activities to ensure successful implementation. Ensure Director of Academic Design/District Coach has confirmed details on implementation summary.


Entry: PO is in process

Exit: Business won


Customer Buying Milestones:


  • Customer submits/executes purchase order.
  • Establishes clear owners for project implementation


Confidence Level Coaching: All proposals in Close should have a Firm confidence level since the entry point is PO in process.


Pipeline Level Coaching: Do you understand the PO approval process? How are you assuring that the PO is moving through the process?

Capitalize on interest expressed in American Reading Company with prioritized and strategic follow-up to secure a meeting with the Sponsors and/or Decision-Makers identified during the Target phase.


Entry: Interest expressed in American Reading Company

Exit: Decision-Maker and/or Sponsor agrees to meet


Customer Buying Milestones:


  • Shows an expressed interest in learning more about ARC
  • Agrees to a meeting with Sponsor and/or Decision-Maker(s)


Confidence Level Coaching: All prospects have a default level of “No” confidence. Has the prospect indicated a sense of urgency or a strong desire to partner with ARC that indicates they will likely move to pipeline? If so, they may be a “Yes”.


Pipeline Level Coaching: What moves are you making to identify and gain access to the Decision-Maker?

Meetings have begun with Decision-Makers and/or Sponsors to confirm district requirements and philosophical alignment between the district and ARC. Specific opportunities are identified that meet ARC's Qualification Criteria. Initial objective of the project has been identified.


Entry: Decision-Maker and/or Sponsor agrees to meet

Exit: Implementation meets all Qualification Criteria:


Customer Buying Milestones:


  • Customer begins to articulate needs and goals
  • Qualification questions are answered


Confidence Level Coaching: Has the Decision-Maker indicated a sense of urgency or a strong desire to partner with ARC that indicates they will move to pipeline? If so, they may be a “Yes”.


Pipeline Level Coaching: Are you asking the right questions to determine if the customer meets the Qualification Criteria?

Strategic activities are performed to position American Reading Company’s capabilities, cultivate interest, and ultimately, generate qualified prospects. Interest is generated through execution of Territory Plans, key strategies, and campaigns. Sales activities may include execution of a variety of customer-facing events proven to be successful. Ideally, potential Decision-Makers and/or Sponsors are identified as interested in American Reading Company.


Entry: Identified based upon Territory Plans, key strategies, and campaigns

Exit: Interest expressed in American Reading Company


Confidence Level: Confidence in pre-pipeline is a yes/no and only indicates confidence of deal moving into pipeline


Pipeline Level Coaching: Targets are the universe of potential customers.
